history: Example JSON file for TCR coupled runs. Copy and adjust for your needs and update the history. Modified to focus on leading 5 params
svnInfo_comment: Information automatically updated by SVN -- please don't edit
Developer_comment: StudyConfig.py provides methods that work with this configuration file. Remember to change them if you change structure of this.
Name: JCTC
baseRunID_comment: base for runID. Only first two characters are generally used. Set to jc to reuse exising Ctl runs used to diagnose ECS4
runTime_comment: Time in seconds for run. If null then default value will be used.
runCode_comment: Project code to run job under.
machineName_comment: Name of machine to submit runs to
modelName_comment: Name of model that is ran
optimiseFunction_comment: Name of optimisation function to run. null gives default
fakeFunction_comment: Name of fake function to use for testing. null gives default. Your fake fn should match your postProcess skip whick it fakes.
runUpgrade_vn3: For vn3 put all runXXX & function stuff in a runInfo block.

defaultParams.comment: Default parameter values for HadAM3. null values or not set mean don't modify. Checked against wiki 11/5/17
defaultParams.CW_LAND_comment: Seed parameter which also affects CW_SEA
defaultParams.DYNDIFF_comment: Seed parameter which affects DIFF_COEFF, DIFF_COEFF_Q, DIFF_EXP & DIFF_EXP_Q
defaultParams.KAY_GWAVE_comment: Seed parameter which also affects KAY_LEE_GWAVE
defaultParams.CHARNOCK_comment: Note this is Murphy et al, 200X and is different from that reported in Yamazaki et al, 2013
defaultParams.ALPHAM_comment: Seed parameter which affects DTICE and ALPHAM
defaultParams.RUN_TARGET_comment: Run target -- time as 3 to 6 element array to run for.

initParams.comment: Intial values for parameters to be optimised. Set to null to use default values.  TODO -- only ones which have sig effect

Parameters.initScale_comment: If true then startParams range from 0 to 1 where 0 means min value; 1 max value.

fixedParams.comment: List of parameters and values that are fixed and not modified in optimisation. Set to null to use default values
fixedParams.insig_comment: Parameters above have insignificant effect on TCR4
fixedParams.small_comment: Paramters above have small effect on TCR4 |dTCR/dNormp| < 1

Parameters.fixedScale_comment: If true then scalable fixedParams range from 0 to 1 where 0 means min value; 1 max value.

minmax.comment: Defines the minimum and maximmum ranges for the parameters. Must be defined for ALL parameters used in GN optimisation,

steps.comment: Steps for perturbations -- norm around 10% of the range. If not specified 10% will be used. Values below used results from Rowlands et al to make guess at pertub needed.
steps.scale_steps_comment: If true then scale the steps.

study.comment: Parameters that specify the study. Used by framework and not by optimisation routines
study.ensembleSize_comment: Ensemble size for each evaluation. Not currently used by gaussNewton
study.referenceModelDirectory_comment: Full path to Directory where reference model configuration exists. Default is None.

covariance.comment: Covariance matrices and operations on them. If CovObsErr and CovIntVar are *both* specified then CovTotal will be computed from them
covariance.CovTotal_Comment: Name of file containing Covariance Matrix for total Error.
covariance.CovTotalDiagonalise_comment: If true diagonalise the total covariance matrix
covariance.CovIntVar_Comment: Name of file containing Covariance Matrix of Internal Variability
covariance.CovIntVarDiagonalise_comment: If true diagonalise the internal variability covariance matrix
covariance.CovObsErr_Comment: Name of file containing Covariance Matrix for Observational Error
covariance.CovObsErrDiagonalise_comment: If true diagonalise the Observational Error covariance matrix

study.ObsList_comment: List of Observations that Algorithm uses which should be generated by post processing of model
study.constraintName_comment: Name of constraint variable -- target value defined by targets/constraintName.

optimise.comment: Parameters to control optimisation. This is used within optimisation routines AND not by framework
optimise.algorithm_comment: Algorithm to be used.   See Optimise.py for more details.

postProcess.comment: Options to control post processing. Details depend on your post processing script.
postProcess.script_comment: Full path name -- including any environment variables you might have -- to postprocessing script
postProcess.outputPath_comment: Name of output file -- default is observations.nc

targets.comment: Observed targets for optimisation. Values are default sens. values.

scalings.comment: Scalings on observables -- only defined when not 1.0

simulatedObservations.comment: simulated observations -- dummy to be used when there is a model failure and it turns out to be unfixable. Made the netflux very large and the rsr_nhx large. This means that this model has high error..

SimulatedValues.comment: Values from Initial Cond ensemble -- used for display
